modules.description: This module provides functions to retrieve the current time as a `Ptime.t` value, break it into days and picoseconds, and obtain the current timezone offset in seconds. It also includes functions to get the system's time measurement period, if available, in both `Ptime.span` and days-picoseconds formats. These operations are useful for precise timekeeping, timestamp generation, and handling time intervals in networked or system-level applications.

This module manages a mutable reference to a time value, including optional timezone offset and periodic update interval. It provides functions to set and update the current time, configure timezone adjustments, and define a repeating time interval. Concrete use cases include simulating clock behavior in virtualized environments and controlling time progression in testing or event-driven systems.
